words.def: A support person, usually female, who may not have medical or midwifery training, who provides emotional assistance to a mother or pregnant couple before, during or after childbirth.
using the voice
characterized by or producing sound of great volume or intensity
weight to be borne or conveyed
praise, glorify, or honor
consisting of or involving two parts or components usually in pairs
a Scottish word
past times (especially in the phrase `in days of old')
An Arabic and Turkish plucked string instrument  resembling a lute.
room within a harem.
a boy or man
two items of the same kind
a unit of pain intensity
Alternative spelling of dahl.
a rapid active commotion
a doctor's degree in optometry
an uproarious party
a public promotion of some product or service
The Indian mulberry , , especially as used to make dye.
a white soft metallic element that tarnishes readily
